resources.string: Boot Manager is the must have app for any flashaholic allowing you to boot up to 5 ROMs on your phone at a time and reboot between them with just a reboot!

Bentotbox for all the help you've been and help with the awesome viewpager and fragments

RevNumbers for all the 2nd init teachings and helping to get 2nd init devices supported

Apophis9283 for all the help on the forum and all his ideas for Boot Manager

Sora1995 for all the IRC help and ideas as well

Black-ice for the Italian translation.

GioBru56 for updating the Italian translation.

webfeind2000 for the nice idea on resizing imgs

Con247 for the scripts to flash boot.img on rezound through recovery for failsafes and also for help testing and throwing ideas around 

drellisdee for the mainver fix when using Con247's method for flashing boot.img in recovery on rezound.

 Thanks
Thank you for using Boot Manager please rate and comment in the market it would be much appreciated!

You have connected your phone to your computer via USB the stock Android mounter will no longer work because of the changes Boot Manager has made to your phone. Please use this screen to mount your sdcard.
Are you sure you want to reboot?
What is your system\'s size in mb?
What is your data\'s size in mb?
What is your cache\'s size in mb?

This app works as your recovery for all ROMs installed to your sdcard. Install themes, kernels, and any other update.zips through this app in the Install ROMs section.\n\nThe phone ROM is the only thing that uses your recovery.
Set up your Phone ROM so that you can boot back to the ROM installed to your phone
If your device is unsupported, see the help section for how you can manually support your device.\n\nPlease email us as well so we can add support for your device.

If your sdcard ROM feels laggy it could be due to your sdcard. Class 2 sdcards usually come with the phone and have a much lower read/write speed then sdcards of higher classes.\nWe recommend you purchase an sdcard of class 6 or higher for optimal performance.
You can rename the ROM names that appear on the buttons by selecting set names in the Boot Installed ROM section
Use the widget for easy ROM switching

Please rate and comment in the market to support us. Also don't heistate to tell your friends about Boot Manager

Thank you for using Boot Manager.

If you have any questions, problems or issues please email us before rating/commenting badly, chances are we can solve your problem/issue quickly and easily as well as answer any questions you may have.
You do not have enough space on your sdcard to install a rom! Please clear some space before installing
Ext2: Compatible with most rom\'s\nExt4: Experimental-Faster but not all rom\'s support it\nIf your not doing a full wipe please select the same filesystem currently installed to this slot
Are you sure your variables are set correctly\? Wrong variables will cause the rom\'s not to boot.
Please run Setup Phone in main screen before installing ROM\'s. This will backup your current boot.img so that it can be restored when you want to boot back to this rom.
Do Not run this if you are booted into one of the sdcard rom\'s. This is only to be run from the phone\'s ROM.

Your current rom\'s boot.img has been successfully stored so you can boot back to this rom. You only need to run this again if you change the regular rom on your phone through recovery. While this app does not change anything in your rom on the phone now it is still a good idea to make a Nandroid backup in recovery.
Backup of your boot.img has failed. Please try again.
This is an unsupported device, if you think this is a mistake send us an email or input your information manually
Are you sure you want to cancel the current install\?
Are you sure you want to empty your trash (LOST.DIR .Trash-100) folders from your sdcard, this can clear a lot of space
Changes made successfully, would you like to reboot now\?
Quick tips to help you use this app correctly
Only use this if your device was not detected!
Donations aren\'t needed but much appreciated. All donations will go towards new test devices, and server costs.
Mount the Sdcard automatically when usb is connected\?

To install a zip select Install Zip\'s from the main screen. This then will take you to a list of file\'s on your sdcard. Select the zip you wish to install. You then will be taken to the zip installer screen. There are 3 checkboxes for wiping the img\'s that the zip\'s install too select to wipe them only if you are overwriting the slot. If your installing an updated version of a ROM that\'s already installed to the slot then only select wipe system. If flashing an add-on to a ROM such as gapps or a kernel don\'t select any of the wipe checkboxes. After selecting your checkboxes select the slot you wish to install to.

To boot to a different ROM you have installed, select Boot Installed ROMs from the main screen or use the widget. This will take you to a list of ROM\'s you have installed then just select the rom you want to boot to. You may also name the ROMs you have installed by selecting the set names button in the manage installed ROMs section.
Setting up your phone\'s normal rom.

The app prompts you to set up the phone ROM when you first install it. This will make a copy of your boot.img so that it\'s available when you want to boot back to your normal phone ROM. This only needs to be done once unless you change the phone ROM. If you flash a new ROM to the phone through recovery then reinstall this app and choose setup phone rom from the main screen to update the saved boot.img for your phone rom.

To find these variables so that you can enter them manually you will need to use adb shell.

Find Device

In adb shell type

getprop ro.product.board

For the rest of the variables we need to reboot to recovery and use adb shell again. In recovery select the partitions section and mount your sdcard to your phone not the computer, mount data, system and cache as well.

To find sdcard block in adb shell type

mount sdcard
mount

Then look for the line that has sdcard in it. It will have a path in the same line. It will be /dev/block/mmcblkXpX where X is numbers

To find the sizes of system, data, and cache type in adb shell

df -h

You should see the size's in mb's of the three sizes. Please enter them in mb's in the manual variables screen.

Google Market was not detected while installing this rom but is required for BootManager to function. If this rom requires gapps to be flashed to have Google Market please install it before booting to the rom.
Click to clear log from sdcard
Please only send your log if requested from GFlam or Conap
This changes the cache size for reading from SD. Changes are made deep in your OS and can be dangerous but also can have a very positive effect, use at your own risk!
A good value(in kb) is 2048 or 3072 but test for yourself!
Keeps your screen on during install, use if you have a profile to underclock your phone when the screen is on.
It appears Boot Manager has been tampered with!
Failed to check license can\'t continue!
Your key is incorrect! If you have purchased Boot Manager please contact us for a new one.
This application is not licensed. Please purchase it from Android Market, if you are on an sd rom and forgot to install the gapps select the phone ROM button.
Phone setup has failed. Make sure your running a 2ndInit rom
Your phone rom has been backed up successfully!!

The flash_image binary needed to flash your boot.img does not exist would you like to download it now? (If you don\'t have data you can reboot to recovery and flash the update.zips in the slots to boot different slots)
Select to disable usb notifications (Only use if on phone ROM)
BootManager currently requires a 2ndInit rom with GB kernel to be installed as the phone rom.

File systems detected on your phone:

Ext2 - Detected
Ext4 - Detected

Please make sure the rom your installing supports your choice too.

Ext4 - Not Detected

Please use ext2 for installs.

Ext2 - Not Detected
Ext4 - Detected

Please use ext4 for installs and make sure the rom your installing also supports ext4.
\nBootManager can not determine what filesystems your rom supports at this time.
Use slot name as viewpager titles (Restart Boot Manager to Apply)
Wiping dalvik cache requires a reboot and once finished your device will be rebooted

Force BootManager to use the old method of putting busybox in the boot.img. This is how it was done in v3.3 or older.

The number of additional slots you would like to create (does not include phone ROM)
